New Records: Anthony Edwards' 33-point performance marked his eighth consecutive game scoring at least 20 points, a feat last achieved by Kevin Garnett in 2004.
Key Match Events: Anthony Edwards led the Minnesota Timberwolves to a commanding 135-119 victory over the Chicago Bulls.
Edwards added eight rebounds, six assists, and a block, shooting 13-of-23 from the field and 5-of-9 from beyond the arc.
Post-Match Reflections: Edwards' consistency and versatility have set the tone for Minnesota’s promising start, drawing comparisons to Kevin Garnett.

The Minnesota Timberwolves’ resurgence, fueled by Anthony Edwards' standout performances, recalls the dominant play of Kevin Garnett during his years with the franchise, sparking hopes for another potential deep playoff run.
